column1: #FORMAT=WebAnno TSV 3.2
#T_SP=webanno.custom.Referent|entity|infstat
#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=With obsessions such as paraphilias , a person presents things to themselves in a series of questions .
#Text=What if I 'm really gay ?
#Text=What if I really want to seduce my patient ?
#Text=What if I really was aroused by a picture of that child ?
#Text=If someone comes to you and says , ' I just ca n't get out of my head the thought that I want to kill my baby ' , how do you handle such a challenging problem ?
#Text=It is very challenging .
#Text=Obviously , the risk of potential outcome judges how intense the intervention has to be .
#Text=For example , someone who is thinking a lot about wanting to kill his or her child , that is a very serious thing .
#Text=An evaluation would have to look very carefully at what is the likelihood of such a thing happening , is it really a symbolic way of expressing something ?
#Text=For example , ' Susie pissed me off so much I could kill her . '
#Text=As opposed to having a vision of slashing her throat , burning her body and tossing her into the ocean .
#Text=That would be considered a very serious concern .
#Text=The difference is between having a thought occur , and actually acting it out in one 's head ?
#Text=It 's " I thought about wanting to kill my baby , " versus , " I 'm picturing drowning my baby in the bathtub almost every night I wash her . "
#Text=Yes , that is the very important differential .
#Text=Many of us have all kinds of thoughts , like the seduction of a student by a teacher , or those kinds of things .
#Text=We have them , it 's part of our humanity .
#Text=The taboo nature makes it alluring .
#Text=But it 's when the person fears losing control , and the ability to control the thinking .
#Text=There 's a very big difference between a thought and an action .
#Text=I have a personal example that makes me laugh .
#Text=There is a 60-year-old woman at work named Barbara who I have never met , but to whom I have spoken on the phone .

#Text=I do n't know many Barbaras , but I remember the opening scene of Night of the Living Dead where the brother and sister are in the cemetery and to give the sister , Barbara , a scare , the brother starts going , " Baahbarah , Baaahbarah , they are coming to get you , Barbara . "
#Text=It makes me laugh to imagine a scenario of calling this 60-year-old Barbara at work and saying that into the phone .
#Text=I have acted this out many , many times with my office mates , and it makes us laugh .
#Text=It 's making me laugh now , the thought of doing something that bizarre —
#Text=[ Laughs ] — And behind this is what ?
#Text=Behind it is the idea ...
#Text=I would never ...
#Text=Barbara 's the boss ?
